offices.note: 80+ US offices, listed major consulting hubs

hires_mba.note: MBA hiring confirmed via career portal

career_path.note: Multiple sources confirmed progression: Consultant → Senior Consultant → Associate → Lead Associate → Senior Associate → Principal → VP

travel.note: Varies by role; DC-area roles often have less travel, mid-level can see 50-80% travel

work_hours.note: Rated 4.2 for work-life balance, paid overtime for entry-level, varies by team/contract

compensation.ug.base.note: Entry-level consultant range $75-80K based on 2025-2026 data

compensation.ug.bonus.note: Performance-based bonus, estimated ~$10K for entry level

compensation.mba.bonus.note: Bonus brings total comp to ~$175K, estimated ~$45K bonus

recruiting.process.note: No case interviews, behavioral/situational focus confirmed by multiple sources

recruiting.timeline.note: 4-6 weeks total, often decisions within one week after final round

gaps.reason: No reliable data found on signing bonus for undergraduate hires
No reliable data found on signing bonus for MBA hires

notes: Pre-populated data from CSV covered LinkedIn/BYU fields. Booz Allen is unique among consulting firms: no case interviews, government/defense focus, security clearance required. Strong BYU alumni presence (65 current, 271 all-time) makes this an accessible firm for BYU students through alumni networking. Management Consulted profile could not be accessed directly (403 error), but supplementary sources provided compensation and recruiting details. Firm is publicly traded (not partnership structure like MBB), which affects career progression terminology (VP instead of Partner).
